topic.title: How to Install Feedback Enterprise Service on Linux

ul.li: Google Chrome 78.0 [recommended for optimal performance and user experience]

p.note: It is recommended to create a dedicated user to configure and run the service.

ol.li:
Create an installation directory, then download and unzip the Feedback installation package there.
Sample code to create the install directory: sudo mkdir /opt/feedback sudo chown feedback: /opt/feedback
Sample code to extract the archive content: cd /opt/feedback tar zxvf oxygen-feedback-{version}-SNAPSHOT-package-enterprise.zip

[Optional] [Recommended] Create an application home directory. By default, the Feedback home directory value is the installation directory, but if you want to define a custom value, you can add the custom path to feedback-home.properties or pass it via the -Dfeedback.home= JVM argument.The structure of the home folder should contain the config and data directories.
The home directory is used to store configuration files and application data (such as images for avatars and logos). It is recommended to be set to separate application files by the data files.
Sample code to create a home directory: sudo mkdir /var/feedback sudo chown feedback: /var/feedback

Set service port. By default, the service uses the port 8080. To change the port that the service runs on, open {Installation-Directory}/config/feedback-server.properties and set the http.port property to your desired value.
For example: http.port=8081
Set up the database. For detailed instructions, see: .
Set up the license for Feedback Enterprise.
Create your first administrator account, OFB-1636
